Manager, KCTS-TV

Seattle % Washington
Bear Boren:
Bill has asked me to report to you on the current statue of the -various
items you passed on to him after the convention as a result of the meet-*
lag of the TV Board.
In planning for the 1962 convention, we are setting aside a session which
will permit simultaneous meetings of TV station personnel, radio station
personnel, and production center personnel — each group meeting with the
proper members of the MM Board. In addition, we are setting aside a
period for each Regional group to meet with its Birectors, and for Asso¬
ciate members to meet with their Directors, and Individual members to meet
with their Director.
I was a little surprised that the TV managers felt that there was too
little on the convention agenda of interest to them. Actually, in recent
years we have overloaded in the direction of TV - to such an extent, in
fact, that the radio members are complaining more loudly than the TV mem¬
bers. However, we will continue, especially through the various special
interest interest sessions, to provide as much material as possible of
interest to the diversified groups we must serve.
In regard to the 1962 seminar - you will recall that the Board approved
unanimously a recommendation by the Professional Development coaasittee
that available seminar funds be used for a follow-up meeting on last sum¬
mer's seminar, and plans are now underway to hold such a conference. It
If felt that we should not let last summer's "good start" be wasted,
that we should proceed to determine how the Association can best carry out
some of the recoii^ndations growing out of last summer's meeting.
I believe you know that the inventory of STV programs available from sources
other than the Center is currently in progress - being handled by Chris
Donaldson.
